comment: Dr. Ayoub is awesome. She helped me relearn Arabic, but if you're not familiar with the language, you'll have to put in more effort. as long as you do the work, turn in your homework, and try, then you'll do just fine. it's a fun class and she is very understanding, but you need to put in the effort

The most Important thing in a teacher is to love what they do which she does. She loves her students and the way she teaches super interesting. I would highly recommend her for anyone who is interested in Arabic. At the end Arabic is hard to learn, so it would be a challenge for someone who does not speak it, but it is a positive challenge.

She is very passionate about teaching arabic and cares a lot about her students grades. Will accept late work, and the tests/quizzes are really easy.
Highly recommend.

She is a wonderful prof. Gives a bit more work than other classes, but for a good reason, I mean you are learning a whole new language. She is always there for her students, correcting them in an inspirational way, without putting them down. When I broke my main hand, she gave me extra time for assignments and really helped me out. She's the best!!

Dr. Ayoub is super caring and wants her students to succeed. Really, as long as you put in effort, she'll be on your side. There were 3 exams and hw every week. She grades on speaking, listening, reading comprehension, etc. She loves to see interaction and participation in class! Take her! 10/10 recommend.

Dr. Ayoub is super caring and willing to help her students. There is lots of language and effort to put in on the students' part since it's a language class. There's 2-3 exams and lessons in class. Vocabulary with every unit. 10/10 recommend; take her.

Professor Ayoub is super caring and wants her students to succeed. There is homework assigned after every class. She's very willing to work with you and we did a TON of practice in class. Pretty easy class, however it's a foreign language so you have to put in the work. Occasional tests and quizzes. Vocabulary every week. Take her!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Lots of homework--Participation matters

comment: She is far better than some of the other professors that Ive taken in KSU. Puts in a lot of effort to teaching and making sure you understand the subject. It is a lot of homework but it is a foreign language so that is to be expected. However if you do complete the hw you have no problems on the tests or quiz. Also practice speaking, it counts.

She is a nice teacher and she loves what she does, which is great but she gives ALOT of hw. Like this is all from her class due in 3 days, 5-page packet, and 3 book exercises, 1 extra page of hw. She needs to understand that we have other Major classes. Other than that she's great.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Participation matters--So many papers

comment: Professor Ayoub is super kind, caring, and understanding. Since day one, she has been enthusiastic about her language and she has always helped students. She gives homework once a week and it's super easy, usually takes an hour. We maybe had one exam and two/three quizzes. Mostly speaking and writing practice. Participation matters. Take her!

Its a language class so you definitely have to do the work. She makes the class easy because one day you go over new words/letters and the second day we use the vocab. Shes enthusiastic every day and participation is big since she listens to you pronounce words to correct you.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Gives good feedback--Participation matters

comment: Ms. Ayoub wants to see you succeed and offers many chances. She was very flexible on due dates and did not take points off for late work. Would recommend taking again.

So she gives too much work tbh. Shes constantly is adding to the homework, its really easy work but she needs to understand that we all have different classes. I attend this class more than my MAJOR class. Shes a nice teacher but I really hope she understands this.

This professor is absolutely amazing. By far my favorite professor at KSU so far. She works hard to help you understand and learn the language. She brings some of her Arabic culture to the class and is always happy. Class participation is a grade and she gives everyone a chance to participate. And the textbook is heavily used.

Participation is a big part of your grade, so you must attend class and pay attention. The textbook was required for this class, as all the lessons come from it. You definitely have to work for your grade and you'll fail if you don't stay on track. She assigns A LOT of homework and tends to add on to it at the last minute. I wouldn't take again.
